{"step_by_step_thinking": "Deciduous teeth, also known as baby teeth, start to develop in the womb. They begin to erupt at around 6 months of age and are usually fully erupted by age 2. However, the roots of these teeth do not fully calcify or harden until a bit later. The calcification of the roots of deciduous teeth is typically completed by the age of 3 years. However, this is not one of the options given. The closest option to this is 4 years.", "answer_choice": "B"}
